verses.kjv: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.ct: My soul is disgusted with my own life. I will pour out my complaint freely; I will speak from the bitterness of my soul.

verses.kjv: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.
verses.ct: I will say to God, 'Don't declare me guilty. Show me why you are fighting against me.'

verses.kjv: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
verses.ct: 'Does it benefit you to oppress me? Do you reject what your own hands have made while smiling on the plans of the wicked?'

verses.kjv: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?
verses.ct: 'Do you see things the way humans do? Do you look at things through mortal eyes?'

verses.kjv: Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man’s days,
verses.ct: 'Is your lifespan as short as a person's? Are your years as limited as human days,

verses.kjv: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?
verses.ct: that you investigate my guilt and search out my sin?'

verses.kjv: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.
verses.ct: 'You know that I am not wicked, yet no one can rescue me from your power.'

verses.kjv: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
verses.ct: 'Your hands shaped me and formed every part of me, yet now you are destroying me.'

verses.kjv: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
verses.ct: 'Please remember that you made me from clay. Will you turn me back into dust?'

verses.kjv: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
verses.ct: 'Didn't you pour me out like milk and shape me like cheese being formed?'

verses.kjv: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
verses.ct: 'You covered me with skin and flesh and wove me together with bones and tendons.'

verses.kjv: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
verses.ct: 'You gave me life and showed me kindness, and your care has sustained my spirit.'

verses.kjv: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.
verses.ct: 'Yet all along, you kept these plans hidden in your heart. I know this was your intention.'

verses.kjv: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
verses.ct: 'If I sin, you are watching me closely, and you will not let my guilt go unpunished.'

verses.kjv: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;
verses.ct: 'If I am wicked, how terrible for me! And even if I am righteous, I still cannot hold my head high. I am overwhelmed with shame; just look at my suffering!'

verses.kjv: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.
verses.ct: 'For it only grows worse. You hunt me down like a fierce lion, and again and again you display your awesome power against me.'

verses.kjv: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
verses.ct: 'You bring fresh witnesses against me and pile up your anger toward me. Wave after wave of attacks come against me.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!
verses.ct: 'So why did you bring me out of the womb? I wish I had taken my last breath before anyone ever saw me!'

verses.kjv: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
verses.ct: 'I would have been as if I never existed — carried straight from the womb to the grave.'

verses.kjv: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
verses.ct: 'Aren't my remaining days so few? Stop, then! Leave me alone so I can find a moment of comfort'

verses.kjv: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;
verses.ct: 'before I go to the place from which I will never return — the land of darkness and deep shadow,'

verses.kjv: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
verses.ct: 'a land of utter darkness, as black as midnight, a place of deep shadow and chaos, where even the light itself is darkness.'
